en: In the past 90 days, have you been diagnosed with Multisystem Inflammatory Syndrome in Children, also known as MIS-C, or Multisystem Inflammatory Syndrome in Adults, also known as MIS-A, or are you still recovering from either of these diagnoses?

The CDC currently recommends that people with a history of MIS-C or MIS-A should consider delaying vaccination until they have both recovered from illness AND 90 days have passed after the date of diagnosis.
Never diagnosed with MIS-C or MIS-A
Yes, I have been diagnosed with MIS-C or MIS-A in the past 90 days or I am still symptomatic from this diagnosis
No, I have fully recovered from MIS-C or MIS-A more than 90 days ago
sp: ¿Ha recibido anticuerpos monoclonales como parte del tratamiento contra el COVID-19 en los últimos 90 días?
Los Centros para el Control y la Prevención de Enfermedades (CDC) recomiendan que se difiera la vacunación al menos 90 días después del tratamiento con anticuerpos monoclonales.
